intro: Ervatamia chengkiangensis, commonly known as the Chengkiang ervatamia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an important subject for botanical research. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
